newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine parliament wants privatisation paper delay.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine parliament wants privatisation paper delay.

text.p: Ukraine's parliamentarians want to extend the deadline for buying privatisation certificates until December 31, 1997, the deputy head of the parliamentary privatisation commission said on Thursday.
Serhiy Sobolev told Reuters that the new deadline would be included in a parliamentary resolution regulating the privatisation process next year.
If passed this would be the third deadline extension since the beginning of the year.
Sobolev said anyhow that President Leonid Kuchma could veto the move. "I don't rule out that the president may use his veto power on this document," Sobolev said.
Each Ukrainian is entitled to a privatisation certificate, worth about $275 each, to invest in an enterprise undergoing privatisation.
About 80 percent of the population have claimed the certificates, and the rest were to claim them by the end of this year and invest them by mid-1997.
The certificate programme represents the government's attempt to involve all citizens in the privatisation process.
